jamExperience.title: What a Jam feels like
jamExperience.p1:
You arrive with a drink — not a pitch.
Conversations start loosely, then sharpen.
jamExperience.p2:
Someone shares a real decision, doubt, or problem they’re sitting with.
The room listens carefully, then thinks and learn together.
jamExperience.p3:
You leave without a playbook 
—but with better questions and clearer instincts.

why.title: Why Montreal Idea Jams exist
why.thesis:
Most entrepreneurial community optimize for visibility.
We optimize for thinking before building.
why.p1: Entrepreneurship is often discussed in rooms designed for pitching, networking, or personal branding.
why.p2: But the most important moments — doubt, trade-offs, unfinished ideas — rarely survive those formats.
why.p3: MIJ exists to make space for slower conversations, real uncertainty, and collective thinking — without applause or performance.
